Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: FIXED A1466 820-00165-A backlight problem
threads.message:
only backlight flash for second then turns off
mother board is already repaired
backlight fuse shorted and  J8300 due burn out replaced 
I  reset PRAM 3 times , replaced U7701 and Q7706 but not fixed
SMC_LID is good 3.3v
EDP_BKLT_PWM 1.47v
SMC_LID 3.42v
any suggestions ?

threads.title: FIXED A1466 820-00165-A backlight problem
threads.message:
"J8300 due burn out"
LCD cable wasn't affected?
Did you test with known good LCD assembly?
Did you check XW7720 continuity?

threads.message:
XW7720 is good 
LCD cable was affected but i test at other good working lcd assembly

threads.title: FIXED A1466 820-00165-A backlight problem
threads.message:
Check BKL_EN/PWM (U7701 side).
Be sure D7701 is not shorted A-K.
Post Q7706/7 voltages.

threads.title: FIXED A1466 820-00165-A backlight problem
threads.message:
"Q7706  ALL pin 8.56V"
So is damaged, requires low voltage on pin 3; change it.

I have doubts about Q7707, or the posted readings.
Check R2088 and post U2071 voltages.

This looks strange, don't you think?

You may have bad solders for U7701.
Post diode mode to ground on all its connections.
Use surrounding components as test points.

threads.title: FIXED A1466 820-00165-A backlight problem
threads.message:
Q7706's pin 3 should have much lower voltage; aprox 2V only.
Just in case, remove C7782 and check again.
Be sure to solder Q7706 in correct orientation.
Is the replacement used P-channel MOSFET for sure?

Q7706 is correct and from working doner board

threads.title: FIXED A1466 820-00165-A backlight problem
threads.message:
Please, calculate Vout (LCDBKLT_EN_DIV_L) voltage of R7788/89.
Consider LCDBKLT_EN_L is 0V and Vin=8.4V (PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLTFET) (as you've mentioned before).
I can't get 7.9V myself...

threads.title: FIXED A1466 820-00165-A backlight problem
threads.message:
Disconnect the webcam and test again; including KB backlight.

Why to force?
You've said to have 0V at pin 3/Q7707; change it, if in doubts.

threads.title: FIXED A1466 820-00165-A backlight problem
threads.message:
I disconnect everything and replace charging board and its flat cable ,touch-pad  fcc test other good working lcd assembly everything ok else no backlight when i close lid then open it backlight flashed then turns off
i replaced U7701 with new one
SMC_LID 3.3v
EDP_BKLT_PWM 2.49v
SMC_LID 3.42v
pin 3 for Q7707  is 0v now
what to test else?

threads.title: FIXED A1466 820-00165-A backlight problem
threads.message:
"pin 3 for Q7707  is 0v now"
Was it before too; but you didn't get correct LCDBKLT_EN_DIV_L.
That's really strange.

Be sure to have good continuity between Q7706 and L7701; check R5490, if exists.

If backlight flashes one time, means U7701 boosts, but detects some problem and stops.
Usually XW7720 may cause this.
Check continuity from ball A5/U7701 to D7701's cathode.
Also check the value of all return resistors (R7717-22); be sure to have good solders and traces.

threads.title: FIXED A1466 820-00165-A backlight problem
threads.message:
the continuity between Q7706 and L7701 is perfect
R5490 not exist just track onboard
i replaced D7701 not fix the problem
i replaced L7701 the issue fixed! :)
L7701 swollen and expolded from the underside .
